did.head: Collection Summary
did.physdesc: 164 photographic prints : black and white ; various sizes
319 photograph files (AI, EPS, JPG, TIF, PSD) : digital
84 video files (MOV, MP4, AVI, WVM, IFO, VOB, BUP) : digital

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English and Italian.

corpname.part: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of fieldwork conducted by Joseph Sciorra and his collected papers and materials, 1980s-2018, relating to Italian American folklife primarily in New York City but also in Italy. Topics include Catholic religious expression and material culture in the form of altars, processions, shrines, social clubs, feasts, games, puppeteering, visual arts, folk poetry, and music.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Joseph Sciorra collection was processed by Maya Lerman in 2022. Digital content in the collection was processed by Sara Ludewig in 2024.

In 2022, Maya Lerman assigned each piece of digital media a unique digital ID number and ripped audio discs from CDA to WAV format. Sara Ludewig identified duplicate content and processed each digital carrier into archival information packages (AIPs). She deaccessioned files contained on the following digital ID numbers: DC006, DC009, DC032, DC040, DC065, DC066, DC067, DC076, DC077, DC078, DC079. The optical discs that originally housed digital files were retained as part of the collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
Related materials can be found in the
Brooklyn Rediscovery Folklife Study Project collection (AFC 2017/035)
, in which Sciorra contributed fieldwork.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p:
The rights in this collection held by Joseph Sciorra are governed by copyright for his lifetime. When this term has expired, Sciorra dedicates his rights to the public domain. While the collection is still under copyright patrons may reuse materials under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 license
https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/
. Third party rights may be governed by copyright or other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p:
The Joseph Sciorra collection is open to research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at
https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Joseph Sciorra collection (AFC 2018/065), American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph Sciorra is a folklorist and scholar who is the Director for Academic and Cultural Programs at the John D. Calandra Italian American Institute, Queens College (City University of New York).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of research, fieldwork, interviews, and other documentation conducted and gathered by Joseph Sciorra, 1980s-2018, primarily relating to Italian American folklife but also to New York City neighborhoods and other immigrant communities. Topics include Catholic religious expression and material culture in the form of altars, processions, shrines, social clubs, feasts, games, puppeteering, visual arts, folk poetry, and music.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Joseph Sciorra collection is organized into 6 series according to intellectual topics/groupings. Within each series material is arranged alphabetically. The series are titled:

item.ref: Series 1. Religious feasts and processions/Giglio Feast and other (primarily Italian American) religious feasts and processions
Series 2. Italian American religious expression and material culture
Series 3. Italian American music, theater, poetry, and visual arts
Series 4. Fieldwork and research about New York City neighborhoods
Series 5. Administration, meetings, and professional pursuits
Series 6. Italy and Italian American communities research

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

Sicilian Americans--New York (State)--New York--Social life and customs.

Series 1. Religious feasts and processions/Giglio Feast and other (primarily Italian American) religious feasts and processions,

scopecontent.p: Manuscripts, photographic material, moving images and sound recordings documenting the Giglio Feast, an Italian American religious festival and street fair, as well as other religious feasts and processions.
